smell_analysis.justification: The diagram 'Autode register (Töötaja)' on page 13 is empty, containing only the diagram frame with no model elements inside.
All use cases in the diagrams (Pages 2, 3) are connected to actors.
No use cases with synonymous names for the same actor were found. 'Muuda autot' and 'Muuda auto mitteaktiivseks' describe different scopes of action.
No duplicate model element names were found within the same package.

No redundant data value copies were found in tables without foreign keys. Common column names like 'reg_aeg' (Registration Time) or 'nimetus' (Name) in tables like 'Isik' and 'Auto' represent different data instances, not denormalization.
All use cases start with a verb in the imperative form (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Registreeri').
All states in the 'Auto seisundidiagramm' (Page 9) are reachable from the Start node.
All actions in the 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm' (Page 4) are reachable.
All relationships in the class diagrams (e.g., Page 5, 12, 18) display multiplicity indicators (e.g., 1, 0..*).
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements. The largest class/table diagram (Page 16) has 9 tables.
No class or table has 6 or more visual connection lines on a single page. The maximum observed is 5 connections for the 'Isik' class on Page 6.
The layout of elements appears standard with no excessive distances between related elements.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Otsi autot', 'Registreeri auto').
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found with 3 or fewer characters. Shortest names found were 4 characters (e.g., 'Isik', 'Riik', 'Auto', 'kood').
All class names begin with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto').
All attributes/columns start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'nimetus').
All database table names are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Kasutajakonto').
No Hungarian notation or type prefixes were found in element names (standard PK/FK indicators in tool-generated schemas are allowed).
